summary: A subpoena issued by the U.S. District Court for the Southern District of New York to AT&T Corporation, commanding its appearance and production of records related to Jeffrey Epstein's account for a specific billing cycle in May 2004, as part of the criminal case United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The subject of the criminal case (20 Cr. 330 (AJN)) for which the subpoena is issued to obtain evidence.

persons.name: Jeffrey E Epstein
persons.context: The account holder for whom telephone records (usage and invoice) from May 2004 are being subpoenaed as evidence in the Maxwell case.

persons.name: Audrey Strauss
persons.context: The U.S. Attorney who signed and issued the subpoena on behalf of the Southern District of New York.

connections.description: The subpoena for Epstein's phone records is issued as part of the criminal case against Maxwell, indicating their alleged connection in the underlying investigation.

events.title: Scheduled Court Appearance for AT&T
events.description: AT&T Corporation is commanded to appear before the U.S. District Court in New York to testify and produce records related to Jeffrey Epstein's account.

events.title: Billing Cycle End for Epstein's Account
events.description: The subpoena specifically requests all usage and the monthly invoice for Jeffrey Epstein's AT&T account for the billing cycle ending on or about this date.

locations: 40 Foley Square, Courtroom 906, Borough of Manhattan, City of New York, New York
AT&T Global Legal Demand Center, 11760 U.S. Highway 1 North, Palm Beach, Florida 33408
One St. Andrew's Plaza, New York, New York 10007
keyFacts: The U.S. Attorney's Office subpoenaed AT&T for Jeffrey Epstein's phone records from May 2004 as part of the criminal case against Ghislaine Maxwell.
The subpoena specifically demands 'all usage' and the 'monthly invoice dated May 5, 2004' for Epstein's account.
Failure to comply with the subpoena would constitute contempt of court, subjecting AT&T to civil sanctions and criminal penalties.
The document indicates ongoing evidence gathering in the Maxwell case as of July 2021, focusing on historical communications from 2004.
